decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead. It utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces and control the game. The deck also includes versatile threats like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to apply pressure while waiting for the combo to come together. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing creatures with low mana costs and efficient removal spells to quickly take control of the board. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison adds additional reach and disruption to keep the opponent on their back foot. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to generate additional threats and apply pressure. Overall, the Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures, removal spells, and disruptive elements.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead. This allows the deck to cheat out big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces, and utilizes cards like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower for additional control and pressure. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and control the game. The key strategy is to reanimate a powerful creature like Archon of Cruelty or Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can respond.

This Death & Taxes deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures and removal spells while applying pressure with efficient threats. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for a larger deck size and the potential to blink valuable creatures for additional value. The deck also utilizes cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial to increase its flexibility and consistency. By combining disruption and aggression, this deck seeks to control the game and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and hand disruption while also maintaining card advantage through card draw effects like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck aims to control the board state and win the game through efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, as well as threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Nethergoyf. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to further dominate the game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Worldgorger Dragon, Archon of Cruelty, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb, Cabal Therapy, and Thoughtseize, and then bring them back into play using reanimation spells like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Dance of the Dead. The deck aims to cheat powerful creatures into play early in the game to overwhelm the opponent and win through a quick combo. Additionally, the deck includes disruption spells like Unmask and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play for cheap or free using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will while setting up the combo to bring back game-winning threats like Archon of Cruelty or Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to control the board and protect the combo. With powerful reanimation spells and a disruptive game plan, this combo-reanimator deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The primary focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. Utilizing cards like Swords to Plowshares, Goblin Bombardment, and Static Prison to control the board and protect key creatures, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and other powerful creatures provide the deck with both offensive and defensive capabilities, allowing it to quickly close out games while keeping opponents on the back foot.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game. It utilizes cards like Street Wraith and Thassa's Oracle to manipulate the top of the deck, while also including disruption with cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize. The goal is to set up the Doomsday pile using cards like Dark Ritual and Personal Tutor, and win the game with a well-constructed sequence of cards. This deck requires careful planning and precise execution to successfully pull off the combo and secure the victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's strategy and gradually take over the game. With a mix of reactive spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, along with proactive threats like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while answering any threats that come its way. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Dress Down and Flame of Anor provide additional utility and flexibility in dealing with a variety of situations.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cards like Mystic Forge, Helm of Awakening, and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate as much mana and card advantage as possible to combo off quickly. Cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Kozilek's Command help control the board while cards like Urza's Saga and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional value and search options. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan to win the game efficiently.

The deck aims to set up a combo using Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's library. It includes cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor to support the combo and generate advantage. The deck also has disruptive elements like Force of Will and Pithing Needle to protect the combo. The mana base includes fast mana sources and lands that support the artifact theme of the deck. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bring them back into play using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. By combining fast mana acceleration with disruptive counter spells and card draw, it seeks to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also utilizes disruptive creatures like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to control the game and protect its combo pieces. Ultimately, it seeks to outpace and outvalue the opponent by leveraging its graveyard recursion and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring back high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier from the graveyard quickly and efficiently. It also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure smooth mana development and provides some utility with cards like Wasteland and Undercity Sewers. The overall strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It includes a variety of counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect your combo pieces. The deck also features disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Wasteland to disrupt your opponent's game plan. With efficient card draw in the form of Brainstorm and Ponder, along with versatile removal in Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent.
